page.title: 07RECREATION IN DEWSBURY
page.content: In a survey of the general public,63% thought that Dewsbury had far too few entertainment opportunities, and 72% thought there was not enought for young people to do. This,too, after the opening recently of a new sports centre. Most thought the sports centre a good idea and 73% had actually attended for swimming,badminton,squash and volleyball.Yet the majority of people chose to pursue quieter or less organised activities in their leisure time, like T.V., reading and walking. Among children questioned, 45% said they never attended clubs at all,and 39% said they never went on holiday, these children being largely Asian.31% of all children attended the library and other activities included Youth Clubs,swimming,Cubs,Scouts,Brownies and Guides.100% of houses have a TV, half had 2 or more and 50% a video.
